articles.headline: Microsoft Can’t Evade Downturn’s Tight Grip
articles.snippet: The company significantly missed Wall Street’s revenue target and reported the first decline in full-year revenue in its 34-year history.
articles.abstract: The company significantly missed Wall Street’s revenue target and reported the first decline in full-year revenue in its 34-year history.
articles.lead_paragraph: Microsoft, the once-swaggering giant of the personal computer industry, has been humbled, both by the recession and by problems of its own making.

articles.headline: A Retreat From Global Banking
articles.snippet: Countries are retreating to national regulations to protect themselves from international financial risk.
articles.abstract: Countries are retreating to national regulations to protect themselves from international financial risk.
articles.lead_paragraph: The era of financial globalization may be coming to an end.

articles.headline: Hamas Shifts From Rockets to Culture War
articles.snippet: Seven months after Israel’s military campaign against its rockets, Hamas has shifted its focus to cultural initiatives to gain support at home and abroad.
articles.abstract: Seven months after Israel’s military campaign against its rockets, Hamas has shifted its focus to cultural initiatives to gain support at home and abroad.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA  Seven months after Israel started a fierce three-week military campaign here to stop rockets from being fired on its southern communities, Hamas has suspended its use of rockets and shifted focus to winning support at home and abroad through cultural initiatives and public relations.

articles.headline: Studios Bring Another Dimension to Comic-Con
articles.snippet: For the first time, the annual convention, a major event on Hollywood’s calendar, devoted an entire day to presenting films in 3-D.
articles.abstract: For the first time, the annual convention, a major event on Hollywood’s calendar, devoted an entire day to presenting films in 3-D.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO  “How many of you have ever wanted to go to another planet?” shouted the filmmaker James Cameron, addressing 6,500 fans here on Thursday.
articles.byline: By Michael Cieply and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Jobless Checks for Millions Delayed as States Struggle
articles.snippet: Sixteen states are paying unemployment benefits with borrowed money, and hundreds of thousands of needy people have waited months for checks.
articles.abstract: Sixteen states are paying unemployment benefits with borrowed money, and hundreds of thousands of needy people have waited months for checks.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Years of state and federal neglect have hobbled the nation’s unemployment system just as a brutal recession has doubled the number of jobless Americans seeking aid.

articles.headline: California Pension Fund Hopes Riskier Bets Will Restore Its Health
articles.snippet: The new investment chief of California’s biggest pension fund thinks he can help it recover from losing almost a quarter of its portfolio last year.
articles.abstract: The new investment chief of California’s biggest pension fund thinks he can help it recover from losing almost a quarter of its portfolio last year.
articles.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO  Big as California’s budget woes are today, so are the problems lurking in its biggest pension fund.

articles.headline: Stock Traders Find Speed Pays, in Milliseconds
articles.snippet: High-frequency trading may give traders using powerful computers an unfair advantage in the stock market, critics say.
articles.abstract: High-frequency trading may give traders using powerful computers an unfair advantage in the stock market, critics say.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is the hot new thing on Wall Street, a way for a handful of traders to master the stock market, peek at investors’ orders and, critics say, even subtly manipulate share prices.

articles.headline: Professor’s Arrest Tests Beliefs on Racial Progress
articles.snippet: Many say what happened to Henry Louis Gates Jr. is a common, if unacknowledged, reality for people of color.
articles.abstract: Many say what happened to Henry Louis Gates Jr. is a common, if unacknowledged, reality for people of color.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  Ralph Medley, a retired professor of philosophy and English who is black, remembers the day he was arrested on his own property, a rental building here in Hyde Park where he was doing some repair work for tenants.
articles.byline: By Susan Saulny and Robbie Brown

articles.headline: Regulators Spar for Turf in Financial Overhaul
articles.snippet: Facing criticism, the administration has scrambled to salvage major elements of its plan to overhaul financial regulation.
articles.abstract: Facing criticism, the administration has scrambled to salvage major elements of its plan to overhaul financial regulation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration scrambled on Friday to defend major elements of its plan to overhaul the nation’s financial regulatory system in the face of significant criticism from lawmakers, the financial services industry, and even senior regulators whose authorities would be eliminated under the proposal.
